AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Vivec gondolier
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the many gondoliers working in the Vivec canals, and spent many days transporting Dunmer, and the occasional outlander, between the cantons. Whilst [PAWN_nameDef] found the job enjoyable, [PAWN_pronoun] was always annoyed watching all the potential customers simply walk past, and over a bridge to the next canton.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: corprus refugee
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was forced out of [PAWN_possessive] old home when the town was quarantined due to a corprus outbreak. [PAWN_nameDef] decided to help the other refugees, and learnt some useful skills on the road to Vivec.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: book shop owner
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] owned a small bookshop in Vivec city, which specialised in selling rare books. One day the Ordinators visited [PAWN_possessive] shop, as they had heard certain heretical tomes were being sold there. Luckily [PAWN_nameDef] managed to escape before they arrived, though without a single drake to [PAWN_possessive] name.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: prophet of Satakal
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: Many believed Satakal spoke directly through [PAWN_nameDef]. Of course this was considered somewhat heretical, as how could Satakal speak through [PAWN_nameDef] if he already speaks through Kind Orgnum. Needless to say, [PAWN_nameDef] eventually decided it was best to lay low for a while.
